info.title: Compile Override API
info.description:
This REST API allows you to perform actions such as adding, changing, copying, deleting, or authorizing compile overrides. Additionally, you can manage details of compile overrides using this API.

There are two ways to interact with compile overrides using this REST API:  

1. Using create command type *HEADER: This indicates that you want to add, change, or delete the compile override header.

2. Using a create command type other than *HEADER allows you to perform actions on the compile override details. Here, valid options include *PRE, *COMPILE, *POST, and *ALL.

port.description: The port to which the server is listening.

/add.summary: Use this path to add a new compile override header or its command detail.
/add.description:
Use this path to add a new compile override header or its command detail.  

Note:  
When you add the compile override header, the default command detail will be automatically added.

post.summary: Use this operation to add a new compile override header or its command detail.
post.description:
Use this operation to add a new compile override header or its command detail.    

Note: Using the create command type *HEADER will automatically add the default command details along with the compile override header.

requestBody.description: Use this input to add a new compile override or its command detail.

/change.summary: Use this path to change the contents or certain attributes of the compile override header or its command detail.
/change.description: Use this path to change the contents or certain attributes of the compile override header or its command detail.

post.summary: Use this operation to change the contents or certain attributes of the compile override header or its command detail.
post.description:
Use this operation to change the contents or certain attributes of the compile override header or its command detail.

Note: Using the create command type *HEADER will change the compile override header. If a different create command type is used, it will change the compile override details.

requestBody.description: Use this input to change the attributes of the compile override or its command detail.

/copy.summary: Use this path to copy the compile override header.
/copy.description:
Use this path to copy the compile override header.

Note:  When you copy the compile override header, its associated command details will be automatically copied.

post.summary: Use this operation to copy the compile override header.
post.description:
Use this operation to copy the compile override header.  

Note:  When you copy the compile override header, its associated command details will be automatically copied.

requestBody.description: Use this input to copy the compile override with its command detail.

copy.summary: How to specify the copy request input parameters value.

/delete.summary: Use this path to delete the compile override header or its details.
/delete.description:
Use this path to delete the compile override header or its detail.  

Note: Using the create command type *HEADER will automatically delete all associated details along with the compile override header.

post.summary: Use this operation to delete the compile override header or its command detail.
post.description:
Use this operation to delete the compile override header or its command detail.   

Note: Using the create command type *HEADER will automatically delete all associated details along with the compile override header.

requestBody.description: Use this input to delete the compile override with its command detail.

deleteResponse200.summary: Response to a successful API call.

message.messageText: Action *DELETE for command detail completed normally. &N Cause . . . . . :   Your request for action *DELETE for command detail completed normally. &N Recovery  . . . :   None needed, this message is informational.

/authorize.summary: Use this path to authorize the compile override.
/authorize.description: Use this path to authorize the compile override.

post.summary: Use this operation to authorize the compile override.
post.description: Use this operation to authorize the compile override.

requestBody.description: Use this input to authorize the compile override.

authorize.summary: How to specify the authorize request input parameters value.

interfaceLevel.description: The interface level must be V16R1M0.

createCommandType.description:
These command type groups create the object commands. The possible values are:

*PRE   
This command type must be used for the Pre commands. 

*COMPILE  
This command type must be used for the create command. 

*POST  
This command type must be used for the Post commands.  

*ALL  
Use this value to delete all command types only if you are in delete mode and if you are in add or change mode, this value is not allowed.  

*HEADER  
Use this value when you want to add, change or delete the compile override header. 

Note:  
When the command type is *HEADER, it indicates that you want to execute an action on the compile override header. If the command type is other than *HEADER, it means that you want to execute an action on the compile override details.

createCommandSequenceNumber.description:
Specify the command sequence number. 

-1 (*NEXT)  
Use this value to allocate the next command sequence number. It will increment by 10    
or round off to the nearest multiple of 10 if you are in add mode. However, if you are in 
change or delete mode, this value is not allowed.  

1 (*ONLY)  
You can use this value with the command type *COMPILE.

-2 (*ALL)  
Use this value to delete all command sequence numbers if you are in delete mode and if 
you are in add or change mode, this value is not allowed.

behaviourOnError.description:
This field indicates in what circumstances a create command detail should be executed. The possible values are:    

*ALWAYS  
This value indicates that the create command detail should always be executed, whether or not there have been errors during the execution of previous create command details.   

*NOTERROR  
This value indicates that the create command detail will not be executed if there have been errors during the execution of previous create command details.   

*ERROR  
This value indicates that the create command detail will only be executed if there have been errors during the execution of previous create command details.   

*SAME                                                     
Use this value to indicate that the behavior on error does not change if you are in change mode. If you are in add mode it contains the default value, the default value for the behavior on error is *NOTERROR.

commandString.description:
The Command String can be used to enter a command string that can be executed by TD/OMS.  The attributes of the command string can be substituted. The substitution variables used are the same as used in action definitions.  

*SAME  
Use this value to indicate that the command string does not change if you are in change mode. It is not allowed in add mode when you try to add compile override details.

addRequest.description: Request data to add the compile override.

interfaceLevel.description: The interface level must be V16R1M0.

status.description: The return status can be *NORM or *TERM. In the case of *TERM look at the messages for more information.

errorResponse.description: This will return the error information.

messageType.description: The message type 'E' indicates an error message, 'W' indicates a warning, while a blank indicates a normal message with no error.

updateDb.description: Specify '1' to update the database or '0' to not update but check only.

toApplicationCode.description:
Specify the To-application code. The possible values are:  

*SAME  
Use this value to indicate that the application code does not change.  

*ALL  
Specify the To-application code to *ALL, It is valid for all applications.

toEnvironmentCode.description:
Specify the To-environment code. The possible values are:  

*SAME  
Use this value to indicate that the environment code does not change.  

*ALL  
Specify the To-environment code to *ALL, It is valid for all environments.

toObjectLibrary.description:
Specify the To-object library. The possible values are:  

*SAME  
Use this value to indicate that the object library does not change.

*ALL  
Specify the To-object library to *ALL, It is valid for all libraries.

crtCmdNewSeqNum.description:
Specify the command new sequence number. The possible values are: 

-1 (*SAME)  
Use this value to indicate that the command sequence number does not change. 

-2 (*NEXT)  
Use this value to modify the command sequence number to a new value. It will increase by 10 or round off to the nearest multiple of 10.

toMemberCode.description:
When connecting a message or a source member the name of this member code must also be specified. The possible values are:  

*SAME  
Use this value to indicate that the detail does not change.  

*NONE  
No member code is involved.

messages.messageText: Object code PGMC is not found. &N Cause . . . . . :   Object code PGMC is not found with specified object type *PGM. &N Recovery  . . . :   Specify the existing one and try your request again.

response200.summary: Response to a successful API call.

message.messageText: Action for compile override completed normally. &N Cause . . . . . :   Your request for action for compile override completed normally. &N Recovery  . . . :   None needed, this message is informational.

compileOverrideDetail.commandString: CRTBNDCL PGM(&TOOL/&OBJC) SRCFILE(&SRCL/&SRCF) SRCMBR(&SRCM) OPTION(&UDVEVTF) TGTRLS(&UDVTRLS) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE)
